nodes.bodyText: removed
Thanks! fixed
Can some details about the error also be logged?
Whoops, appended , failure into the log statement.
👍 Noise-ish.
Since we're doing two things now, is it worth just inlining? Or is this used elsewhere? If it is, any downside to hoisting the log statement out of it?
Sorry, I can't help it.

nodes.bodyText: Do we usually indent string concatenation additional lines? Thought I saw that in other PRs.
Probably should. I'll do it, here.
I've found this recovery suggestion dubious thus far (though I don't have a suggestion here).
I'm not sold on the recovery suggestion thing, overall, honestly. We're either not trying hard enough, or, it was a well-intentioned idea that doesn't make sense in practice.
I’ve always liked the idea of exceptions that lead to wiki pages that explained what happened with links to code, and where people can document issues, workarounds, gotchas. Maybe one day. :-)
Assume you'll update this prior to merging, just a flag to remind you.
To the forCategory factory? Yea, I did the two PRs as siblings, I'll have to update whichever one goes in second.
Formatting seems a little off.
Fixed
Same here - can we get some detailed logged or are they logged elsewhere?

Updated to:
LOG.warn("blah blah", failureToSync);

Lol, when I was in my twenties, and the older engineers would make typos all over the place, I'd look at it, and be like "what is up with these guys?" I understand it, now. It's a combination of tired eyes, tired hands, and too much to write. haha
Anyway, thanks! Will update.
